issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
It seems like [www.codestrong.com|http://www.codestrong.com] is still not showing any dates for Codestrong 3.0, which is a serious blocker for releasing this awesome event.

I tried both Safari and Chrome on Mac OS X and even on Android.

h1. Steps to reproduce

1. Open your favorite browser
2. Visit [www.codestrong.com|http://www.codestrong.com]
3. Compare the result with the attached screenshot. It should say *Spring 2014*, but no concrete dates.
4. Hit the *Scroll down* button next to *Okay, you got my attention. Where do I find out more?*
5. Again, find no dates

h1. Use cases

There are several use cases for having a date:

1. Plan a family holiday before or after the event
2. Allocate training budgets
3. Get the buzz going
4. Buy cheap tickets

I'm sure there are more use cases. Feel free to add them as comments for this ticket.

h1. Possible solutions

A. Pick a date (I'm sure there's an app for that)
B. Cancel it (not recommended given [~jhaynie]'s recent [article on Re/code|http://recode.net/2014/02/13/why-satya-nadella-has-a-fighting-chance-of-saving-microsoft-from-itself/])

I hope to see this resolved as *Fixed* soon. This *IS* your bug ;)
fields.environment:
OS: Mac OS X 10.9.1
Browser: Safari 7.0.1, Chrome 32.0.1700.107

comments.body: Ha. I would move this ticket to marketing for further evaluation and prioritization :)

+1


We could always have a code-not-as-strong (and show off all the competitor platforms).

Seriously, who do we need to pester to get the ball moving.

My suspicion is that they were waiting for Ti.Next to be released.

Thanks for the prod as always Fokke. Here's the update from our side:

http://www.appcelerator.com/blog/2014/02/update-on-codestrong-and-ticonfs-coming-in-2014-to-a-city-near-you/

Closing this bug.

h1. Workaround

Get your ticket for one of the [tiConf|http://ticonf.org] held world-wide this year ;)
